intro: Alyxia novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are showy, with tubular corollas and are usually pink or white in color.
